issues.summary: Comp: Addon Extensions
issues.description:
*Desc:*
Cluster directories Addon Extensions.

*Query Level:*
Directory
File

*Goal:*
If a directory contains a file named extensioninfo.xml and the directories name contains \*addon\* it will be added to the Addon Extensions group.

issues.summary: Comp: Backoffice Extensions
issues.description:
*Desc:*
Cluster all Extensions which contain Backoffice configurations

*Query Level:*
Directory
File

*Goal:*
If a directory contains a file named extensioninfo.xml and also contains backoffice configurations (File name \*\-backoffice\-\*.xml) it will be added to the Backoffice Extensions component.

issues.summary: Comp: Frontend Developer
issues.description:
Desc:
Collect all Files of Type: *.less, *.scss, *.js, *.css
Files used for building the Frontend when using a Accelerator Storefront.

Query Level:
Files

Goal:
Where file name “**.less*” || “**.scss*” || “**.js*” || “**.css*”

issues.summary: Comp: Customized
issues.description:
*Desc:*
Get all classes which have been customized for a project. 

*Query Level:*
Directory

*Goal:*
Where path “**.customize.**”

issues.summary: Comp: Domains
issues.description:
*Desc:*
Check who has most knowledge in a specific domain. Evaluating all files and file paths if they are containing certain domains.
Enable DX-Tools to accept a list of domains to search by. It should be easily adjustable without code change.
The evaluation should not be case sensitive.

*Query Level:*
Directory
Files

*Goal:*
Where path “**<domain>** || file name “**<domain>**”

List of interesting domains:
-	Product
-	Customer
-	Checkout
-	Search / Solr
-	Order
-	Payment
-	SAP
-	Catalog
-	JCO
-	Datahub
-	Backoffice

issues.summary: Comp: Architects
issues.description:
*Desc:*
Check for people having the most commits on custom *items.xml files

*Query Level:*
File

*Goal:*
Where file name = “*items.xml”

issues.summary: Comp: Extensions
issues.description:
*Desc:*
Cluster directories into Extensions.

*Query Level:*
Directory
File

*Goal:*
If a directory contains a file named _extensioninfo.xml_ it will be declared an Extension. Take the name of the directory containing the _extensionsinfo.xml_ file and create a Component.

issues.summary: Hybris Specific Code Analysis
Hybris Specific Components
Hybris Specific Project Evaluation
issues.description:
With this Epic DX-Tools should be enabled to handle SAP Commerce (Hybris) projects.
To do that, new DX-Tools components will be created, which cluster the code into Hybris relevant topics.
Additionally to clustering the git-repo into evaluable components, a code analysis tool should be written, which checks the code for:
- Best Practices: Coding
- Best Practices: Configuration

A documentation of common Hybris Configurations / Patterns / Best Practices can be found here:
https://wiki.dialogdata.de/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=40141053

issues.summary: Introduction DX Tools
Gather Hybris Patterns / Standards
Hybris Quality Tool
issues.description: This task is designed for Hybris seniors to log their hours for helping out with the development of the Hybris Quality Tool.

issues.summary: When exporting images from svg's make their dimensions bigger (720p at least, if possoble, 4k)
As a user, I want to get notified when changes I made in configurations should trigger a project reanalysis
issues.description:
Build a notification system, whenever a change should affect the current analysis results.

Use the notification system from apex, or another angular component to notify the user that the project should be reanalyzed. 

Each change axe should be a different notification and should contain a summary.

Changes that should trigger a reanalysis are:

# ignoring or activating a file
# changing component configuration
# merging authors
# importing tasks (from JIRA)

A notification system should display messages in the following way: 
* you have ignored 25 files and activated 78 files
* you have merged developers (date)
* you changed the component configuration (date when it happened)
* you imported new tasks from JIRA (date when it happened)

Currently we only support the 2 of the 4 configuration features, but we should soon be able to support all of them.

issues.summary: Create a FE form for creating a new Project
issues.description:
h1. Details
When creating a project you need to provide initial configuration data about the project:

* a NAME for the project
* a DESCRIPTION of the project
* a URL to the Git repository or a GIT/SVN log file
* an SCM AUTHENTICATION mode -> NONE if it is a public repository or BASIC AUTHENTICATION
* the default BRANCH
* whether to CLONE ALL BRANCHES or not
* a JIRA URL to the issue tracking system page
* a JIRA AUTHENTICATION mode -> NONE or BASIC AUTH

issues.description:

Create a Project Entity and choose the Database you want to save it to.

issues.summary: Create the structure of a Configuration Entity
issues.description:
A configuration entity contains the values for a configuration schema.

A configuration entity should have the following attributes:
* a name (unique)
* a projectID (unique)
* an analyzerID (unique)
* a description
* a hashmap with the values of the configuration corresponding to the analyzer configuration schema
* what analyzers the configuration depends on (if it has reference fields)

issues.summary: As a user, I want to see DuDe integrated into the Paltform
issues.description:
h1. Summary

Integrate DuDe as an analyzer inside the Platform -> integrate DuDe as a maven module, make it configurable and runnable.

h1. Details
* Talk to Radu to get access to DuDe or take it from Mario
* Mavenize the project and its dependencies
* Integrate it into the platform -> should be easy since there is a class that calls its main functionality.

issues.summary: Integrate Insider as an External Analyzer
issues.description:
Create a class in Insider that Implements the ExternalAnalyzer Interface.

Introduce spring dependencies + change the base package of Insider.

Write a nice Description for Insider and find a logo for him.

issues.summary: Clean the Insider repository
issues.description: Delete the unnecessary files from the Insider repository to not version them anymore. Also strip insider of its Eclipse dependencies.

issues.summary: Mavenize Inisder
issues.description:
Convert the simple Eclipse project into a maven project and integrate it as a module in the platform.

Do NOT use the external repository as a Git submodule. Transfer Insider completely in the Platform project.

Pay ATTENTION that Insider still needs to create a standalone JAR.

issues.summary: As a user, I want to see Insider integrated in the Platform
issues.description:
h1. Summary
Integrate Insider into the platform -> make Insider configurable and runnable inside the platform.

git clone https://Mario_Rivis@bitbucket.org/dxfantastix/insider.git

h1. Details
* Insider needs some refactoring
* Insider needs to be "mavenized"
* Insider repository needs to be cleaned.
* Insider needs to implement the ExternlAnalyzer Interface
* Look at the Main class and start from there.

issues.summary: View all analyzers and details
issues.description:
h1. Summary

Users should be able to see all the analyzers that are available to them on a page with a short description.
Also, there should be a page dedicated to each analyzer with more details.

h1. Details
On the analyzers page, there should be cards with:
* a picture of each analyzer
* it's name
* a short description

On the analyzer details page there should be:
* the analyzer name
* a longer analyzer description
* maybe a link to a github page
* all the configurations associated with this analyzer from every project available
* a statistics board to see how many configurations there are and in how many run configurations a configuration of this analyzer is used
* what results the analyzer can provide
* the configuration schema of the analyzer with details of every configuration field.

issues.summary: Document and test configuration fields
issues.description:
h1. Summary
Document how to use the configuration fields, and test that the creation of certain configuration fields cannot introduce bugs in the platform.

h1. Test

Test every method that creates or sets parameters to the configuration fields!
Also, update the PostConstruct method that verifies the validity of all analyzers configuration schemes.

issues.summary: Create configuration schema
issues.description:
h1. Summary

Any new analyzer should be able to create a configuration schema based on its needs. This needs to be supported via the configuration platform.

h1. Details

Right now there is such a schema in place. Think of new configuration field types that are needed and implement them if necessary.

issues.summary: Be able to view project details
issues.description:
h1. Summary
A project page should be visible in the configuration hub with all the details of the current project.
There should also be a link that would send to the project in the exploration hub.

h1. Details
* Name of the project
* Description of the project
* Initial configuration of the project
* An incremental configuration tab
* All configurations linked to this project with edit/delete capabilities
* A button to add a new configuration to this project
* All run configurations linked to this project with edit/delete capabilities
* A button to create a new Run Configuration in this project
* A history of all run configuration run on this project
* A comments tab for notes
* A link to the exploration hub of the project
* A button to delete the project

issues.summary: Support Incremental Configuration
issues.description:
h1. Summary
The idea is that Dx has multiple configurations that have to be run multiple times to calibrate the results.

h1. Impediments
Ask Radu which these fields are and maybe try to only run the analysis that is necessary for the incremental configuration.

h1. Implementation
* Create a page called incremental configuration
* Preview there the current results, that emerged after the initial analysis
* Also preview the configuration fields that the analysis was lastly run with
* Be able to modify those fields and trigger another analysis (by a button)
* Update the results with the new results
* Keep track of the latest version of the configuration fields and keep them as default values when creating Dx configurations for this project.

issues.summary: Run an initial Dx analysis after init
issues.description:
h1. Summary
After and if the project is initialized properly, run Dx to load the project into memory.

h1. Implementation
* Make GitClient generate the log as Dx expects it, for the last commit on the main branch specified in the project
* Pass the log to Dx and make Dx analyze it
* Show a progress bar at the bottom of the page to see how the analysis is going
* If the analysis fails, notify it in the frontend and notify the reason
* Provide the ability to try again, or to abort

issues.summary: Be able to create new projects
issues.description:
h1. Details
When creating a project you need to provide initial configuration data about the project:
* a NAME for the project
* a DESCRIPTION of the project
* a URL to the Git repository or a GIT/SVN log file
* an SCM AUTHENTICATION mode -> NONE if it is a public repository or BASIC AUTHENTICATION
* the default BRANCH
* whether to CLONE ALL BRANCHES or not
* a JIRA URL to the issue tracking system page
* a JIRA AUTHENTICATION mode -> NONE or BASIC AUTH

h1. Implementation
* Create a form to correspond to the details above
* Save the projects initial configuration to the database
* Validate the project NAME
* Use the Git Client to clone the repository -> throw an error and do not create the project
* Query the GIT link even before initializing the project
* Use the Jira Miner to extract all the issues for the specific project -> throw error, but leave the project created
* Query the JIRA link even before initializing

issues.summary: As a user, I want to be able to manage profiles
issues.description:
h1. Summary
Profiles are projects containers. 
Profiles also have some settings preferences.
A profile has a name and a description
In the future, a Profile should have an owner and only users with certain permissions should have access to view modify edit the profile and all the projects inside.

h1. Actions
# Users should be able to create profiles
# Users should be able to delete profiles
# Users should be able to modify profiles
# Users should be able to create preference settings for a profile
# Users should be able to add/move/remove projects to profiles

issues.summary: As a user, I want to be able to manage Run Configurations
issues.description:
h1. Summary
A run configuration is an ordered list of concrete configurations of desired analyzers
A Run Configuration also contains specific commits that it should analyze or some strategy to determine the commits it needs to analyze.

h1. Actions
# Users should be able to create new Run Configurations
# Users should be able to modify a Run Configuration
# Users should be able to view Run Configurations
# Users should be able to see if Run Configurations are valid (all configurations dependencies are met)
# Users should be able to delete Run Configurations
# Users should be able to RUN Run Configurations
# Users should be able to schedule Run Configurations

h1. Commits strategy
# Users should be able to specify how many commits they want to analyze
# Users should be able to specify a start and end date, and a frequency and the program should determine the commits to be analyzed
# Users should be able to write groovy code to determine which commits are to be analyzed

issues.summary: As a user, I want to be able to manage configurations of analyzers
issues.description:
h1. Summary
A configuration represents a replacement for a populated configuration file for a specific analyzer. It is the data (model) for the analyzers configuration scheme (meta-model).

h1. Actions
I want to be able to create a configuration for any analyzer
I want to be able to view a configuration for any analyzer
I want to be able to modify a configuration for any analyzer
I want to be able to assign a configuration to a project
I want to be able to duplicate a configuration
I want to be able to diff 2 configurations
I want to be able to delete a configuration
I want to be able to see a configuration's dependencies

issues.summary: As a user, I want to know what analyzers I have access to
issues.description:
h1. Summary
Analyzers are the analysis tools that are available for analysis.

h1. Views
# I want to be able to view a page with all analyzers and a short description.
# I want to be able to view details about each analyzer on a page dedicated to the analyzer, where I want to know a short description of the analyzer, what results it can provide, it's configuration scheme and a list of all configurations available for the analyzer

issues.summary: Create a data exploration hub to effectively visualize all data regarding a project
issues.description:
h1. Visualization types:
# Treemap
# Hierarchical Edge bundle
# Forced layered graph
# Code with syntax highlighting
# Issues highlighted in code
# Commit diffs
# Evolution charts
# Radar
# Matrix
# Data table
# Bar charts (for breakdowns)

h1. Unit Dashboards
# Project
# Evolution
# File
# Component
# Team
# Developer
# Tasks
# Task
# Timeframe
# Language
# Region
# Property

issues.summary: Create a fully automated platform that allows users to configure analysis
issues.description:
h1. Components
# Profiles
Are Project containers
# Configurations
Are a replacement for a configuration file for a specific analyzer
# Run Configurations
Are an ordered list of analyzer configurations
# Projects
Represent a system to be analyzed.
Are the link to the Exploration Hub.
# Analyzers
Are analysis tools that provide some kind of software analysis information

h1. Functionality
# Users should be able to view all analyzers available to them
# Users should be able to CRUD configurations for any analyzers
# Users should be able to CRUD projects
# Users should be able to CRUD run-configurations
# Users should be able to organize projects into Profiles

issues.summary: Project Setup
Maintain Hard-/Software
Knowledge transfer & build up
Projectmanagement
Working Time TSR
Cross functional tasks
Functional tasks
